instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.BKLT_EN_R: What is BKLT_EN_R? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. The “_R” suffix means that the signal is asserted when it is high, as in 3.3v, which is the opposite of the “_L”  suffix.
definitions.BKLT_SCL: What is BKLT_SCL? BKLT_SCL is an I2C signal clock line between the LED driver that creates the LCD backlight power rail that powers the backlight in the screen and the screen. The screen needs to speak to the LED driver on this line before backlight voltage will be created..
definitions.LCDBKLT_FB: What is LCDBKLT_FB? LCDBKLT_FB is a feedback line between backlight output and the feedback pin on the LED driver. When this connection is broken, backlight output will be equal to PPBUS_G3H voltage of the system rather than boosting. Since this point is the highest voltage in the system, it is the fastest to corrode when liquid damaged, so it is a very common point to check when there is no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
threads.message:
was bad damage no <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> and around i was clean and make some jumpers.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_BKLT_D</SIGNAL> -  5V
<SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_R</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> 5V
<SIGNAL>BKLT_SCL</SIGNAL> 5V
<SIGNAL>BKLT_SENSE_OUT</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_FB</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>BKLT_PWM_KEYB</SIGNAL> 0V
XW4810 MISSING..IMPORTENT?
BAD <CHIP>U8400</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
threads.message:
"XW4810 MISSING..IMPORTENT?"
More than that!!!

Start repairing trace between <DIODE>D8410</DIODE> and <RESISTOR>R8431</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
threads.message: It is only a trace; run a wire and rebuild.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
threads.message:
sorry but it was my mistake...<RESISTOR>R8431</RESISTOR> was missing. i put it back..sitll to wire between <DIODE>D8410</DIODE> and <RESISTOR>R8431</RESISTOR>?
<DIODE>D8410</DIODE>
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW</SIGNAL>...to where?
and <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0</SIGNAL>...to where?
sorry i just dont see how they connect..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
threads.message: Did you test and no continuity there?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
threads.message:
Do you have continuity from <RESISTOR>R8431</RESISTOR> to <DIODE>D8410</DIODE>???
Their pins are marked in schematic/boardview, use a buzzer to check...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
threads.message:
Then XW8410 is good.

You should try changing <CHIP>U8400</CHIP>.
Be sure all solders and traces are good.
May need to replace all surrounding resistors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
threads.message:
UPDATE:
finally there is back light...but now its stuck on apple logo for 1-2min and fan goes high and shout down.
was enter it to DFU mode try to revive and its stuck on 90% load and give error 1.
there was also very tiny water damage near <CHIP>U5802</CHIP> there was just one damage line that make a  jumper.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
threads.message:
If no data on SSD, then try DFU restore, instead of revive.
If you need to recover the data, start in Target Disk mode and check if can get access to SSD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
threads.message: It’s also don’t pass restore....error 1 full fan speed.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
threads.message: Can you acces its SSD in Target Disk mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
threads.message: can get out from recovery mode...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no backlight
threads.message:
Turn off the T2 machine, and start it in Target Disk mode.
Do not enter into DFU again.
